goal_name: A nation that ensures our food and nutrition security needs are adequately met for all people through increasing sustainable food production systems and improving household production
target_name: Reduce reliance on food imports through import substitution for food products that can be produced domestically
indicator_name: Food Price Inflation Rate or Food Price Index compared to the national consumer price index (how much are prices for food going up or down, relative to all prices in the country-based on VNSO data)
GoalDescription: A nation that ensures our food and nutrition security needs are adequately met for all people through increasing sustainable food production systems and improving household production
PolicyObjectiveDescription: Reduce reliance on food imports through import substitution for food products that can be produced domestically
IndicatorDescription: Food Price Inflation Rate or Food Price Index compared to the national consumer price index (how much are prices for food going up or down, relative to all prices in the country-based on VNSO data)
ComputationMethod: ((Current /Previous)- Current) * 100 OR Follow the LASPEYRES INDEX Formula
Concept: Food prices refer to the average price of particular food commodities globally and across countries. The Consumer Price Index, or CPI, is a tool used to measure how much in dollars consumers need to spend to buy a typical assortment of goods.
DataSource:
* VNSO (CPI regular release), 
 * Department of Agriculture
Definition: Food price inflation refers to the condition whereby there exist increase in wholesale price index of essential food item (defined as food basket) relative to the general inflation or the consumer price index.
Dissaggregation:
* Types of Sellers/shops (supermarkets, wholesale & retail, hardware, etc)
* Area Council level
* Rural/ Urban
* Provincial Level
* National Level
Rationale: The food price index (FPI) measures the changes in prices that households pay for food.
